item.title: The Planning phase
item.description: At its core, planning in software development is about establishing a clear vision for the software project, determining what you want to achieve, and figuring out how best to achieve it1. It’s akin to mapping out a journey before embarking on it, ensuring you have all the necessary tools and knowledge to navigate through the challenges ahead. Key components Requirement gathering and analysis When we talk about requirements, we’re essentially discussing the needs, desires, and constraints of the software project1.
